parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Like, similar to, resembling, of equal rank. From the base of homou; similar.
Neuter diminutive of pais; a childling, i.e., an infant, or a half-grown boy or girl; figuratively, an immature Christian.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Neuter Plural
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From ageiro; properly, the town-square; by implication, a market or thoroughfare.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Neuter Plural
str2: From pros and phoneo; to sound towards, i.e. Address, exclaim, summon.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To play the flute, pipe. From aulos; to play the flute.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To dance. Middle voice from orchos; to dance.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: Intrans: I lament, wail; trans: I bewail. From threnos; to bewail.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To weep, weep for, mourn, lament. Of uncertain affinity; to sob, i.e. Wail aloud.
